technicalAchievements.title: üéØ Technical Achievements
technicalAchievements.description: This implementation solved several challenging compatibility issues while maintaining OAuth 2.1 compliance.

achievements.name: mcp-remote Compatibility Resolution
achievements.problem: mcp-remote had architectural limitations preventing repeated connections to remote OAuth 2.1 servers
achievements.solution: Implemented intelligent redirect URI management that satisfies both OAuth 2.1 compliance and mcp-remote's port detection requirements
achievements.result: ‚úÖ Full compatibility achieved for both local and remote deployments

achievements.name: OAuth 2.1 Compliance
achievements.problem: Needed to implement modern OAuth 2.1 standards while supporting legacy MCP clients
achievements.solution: Built comprehensive OAuth 2.1 implementation with PKCE, proper error handling, and discovery endpoints
achievements.result: ‚úÖ Full OAuth 2.1 compliance with broad client compatibility

achievements.name: Multi-Client Support
achievements.problem: Different MCP clients (VS Code, Claude Desktop) use different OAuth flow patterns
achievements.solution: Implemented client type detection and appropriate OAuth flow routing
achievements.result: ‚úÖ Seamless support for all major MCP clients

issues.cause: Missing or invalid Google ID token
issues.solution: Ensure you're sending a valid Google ID token in the Authorization header
The server includes CORS headers, but ensure your origin is allowed

issues.cause: Invalid redirect URI or client configuration
issues.solution: Check Google OAuth client configuration and redirect URIs

issues.problem: MCP connection fails in Claude Desktop
issues.cause: Incorrect npx configuration or server not running
issues.solution: Verify the server is running on {{SERVER_HOST}} and npx mcp-remote is installed

issues.cause: Previous versions had mcp-remote compatibility issues
issues.solution: ‚úÖ FIXED: Server now includes both server and localhost redirect URIs for full mcp-remote compatibility. Works seamlessly for both local and remote deployments.
